text: Mohammed Umar Bago (born 22 February 1974) is a Nigerian politician. He was born in Minna, Niger State, to a Nupe family,Admin " Biography Umar Bago", Every politician, 2016 He is a Member of Parliament for Chanchaga, Federal Constituency. He stands with the All Progressives Congress Party. "About Bago and office", Shine Eye, 2019 He ran in the 9th National Assembly, contesting for Speaker House of Representatives of Nigeria. He came second to Femi Gbajabiamila. ==Early life and education== Bago was born in 1974. He attended Marafa Primary School, Minna and Federal Government College Jos. He earned his West Africa School Certificate from the WAEC. He earned a bachelor's in political science at Usman Danfodio University, Sokoto.Bio "Bio Umar Bago", Inside Arewa, 28 March 2019 Bago has obtained several postgraduate diplomas and master's degrees, including a postgraduate diploma in management from the Federal University of Technology (FUT) Minna in 2001, a Master of Business Administration (MBA) in economics at the Ambrose Ali University, Ekpoma, in 2003, and a master's degree in finance at University of Calabar in 2005. He is a distinguished alumnus from Cambridge University in the United Kingdom in 2014. ==Career == Bago worked with the United Bank for Africa (UBA), First City Monument Bank (FCMB) and Afri-Bank PLC respectively. He serves as manager at First City Monument Bank.Nass News From banker to politics", Nass News, May 2019 In 2007 he entered politics. He stated, "I won't back down, I just want to correct the mistake of the party leaders by opinion of zonings."Reports APC made mistake of zoning south West", Sahara Reporters, 9 June 2019 He chairs the House Committee on Maritime Safety, Education and Administration. In 2016 he advised the management of the Maritime Commission that 83 staff should be sacked. He stated, "That is how touts are employed."Academy maritime employed 83 staff without due process to be sacked, The Eagle Online, 2016 He urged the Nimasa to spend money wisely in a well and prepared process.News Nass "Reps Task nimasa on efficient budget", The Guardian, 2016 Transform the house of Representatives in to globally acclaimed and recognized legislative institution by reorganizing, restructuring,reinvigorating the en ==Personal life and philanthropy== Bago is married with children. His mother, Hajiya Aisha Mohammed, died on 1 June 2019 after a brief illness.gbajabiamilas opponents Bago losses mum", Daily Post, 1 June 2019 In order to improve the educational quality of his constituency, he bought 1000 forms of JAMB to his people.https://www.independent.ng/covid-19-lawmaker-delivers-11-trailer-loads- of-rice-to-constituents/ And also distributed 11 trailer loads of rice to his constituency as a palliative during Covid-19 pandemic period.https://dailynigerian.com/covid-19-niger-rep-donates-11-trailer-loads- of-bags-of-rice-to-constituents/amp/ == See also == All Progressive Congress Niger State National Assembly NIMASA ==References== Category:1972 births Category:Members of the House of Representatives (Nigeria) Category:Nigerian bankers Category:Living people Category:Action Congress of Nigeria politicians Category:People from Niger State Category:University of Jos alumni
